    ECSE 211 - Design Principles and Methods

    Team 04

    Author:
    Eliott Bourachot

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer.OdometerExceptions

        Main method

        Controls and decides the robots behavior throughout the whole run.

        Manages the order of operations and the throughput of information.

        Initializes all sensors, receives game parameters from wifi, manages Odometer, Navigation, and Localization instances. Enables the robot to localize in its starting corner, navigate to the tunnel, go through the tunnel, navigate to the tree, detect the rings on the tree, pick the rings off the tree, and navigate back to the starting zone.

        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer.OdometerExceptions

      • getCorrectedTheta

        private static double getCorrectedTheta(ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer.Odometer odo)
        Parameters:
        odo -
        Returns:
        the closest multiple of 90 to the given odometer's current theta value.

      • ringsRemaining

        private static int ringsRemaining(int[][] ringArray)
        Parameters:
        ringArray -
        Returns:
        the numbers of rings in the given ringArray that have a value greater than 0 (i.e. number of rings still on tree).

      • getMostValuableRing

        private static int[] getMostValuableRing(int[][] ringArray)
        Parameters:
        ringArray -
        Returns:
        array of [side,level] of most valuable ring.

      • resetRing

        private static int[][] resetRing(int side,
                                 int level,
                                 int[][] ringArray)
        Parameters:
        side -
        level -
        ringArray -
        Returns:
        updated ringArray with the given ring's value reset to 0 to show that this ring has been acquired.

      • getValue

        private static int getValue(int ring)
        Parameters:
        ring -
        Returns:
        the value of the given Color in terms defined by the Project Definition

      • beepRing

        private static void beepRing(int ring)

        Makes the robot beep a certain number of times depending on the value of the given ring.

        Parameters:
        ring -

      • detectRing

        private static int detectRing(SampleProvider colorMean,
                              float[] colorData)

        Samples the color sensor in RGB mode and classifies the normalized reading according to test data.

        Parameters:
        colorMean -
        colorData -
        Returns:
        lejos.Color of detected ring. returns "Color.NONE" if none of the given rings detected.

      • getFastestRoute

        private static double[][] getFastestRoute(double[] starting)
        Parameters:
        starting: - point from which we want to get the fastest route from.
        Returns:
        list of coordinates in tiles (not cm) in clockwise rotation order. The 0th coordinate is the closest coordinate to the starting point.

      • fillGameParameters

        private static void fillGameParameters(java.util.Map data)

        Parses the game parameters from the Wifi Class to build global variables.

        Parameters:
        data: - received game parameters from the Wifi Class.

      • getEntrance

        private static double[] getEntrance()

        The entrance of a tunnel is defined as the tile immediately before the tile in front of the tunnel

        Returns:
        coordinates of entrance of tunnel. Tested on 11/10/2018 by Eliott Bourachot

      • getExit

        private static double[] getExit()

        The exit of a tunnel is defined as the tile immediately after the tile in the back of the tunnel

        Returns:
        coordinates of exit of tunnel. Tested on 11/10/2018 by Eliott Bourachot

      • isTunnelAtRelativeRight

        private static boolean isTunnelAtRelativeRight()

        The "relative right" of the starting zone is the right side of the zone as if the x-y plane is defined in the starting corner. (i.e. for starting corner 0, the relative right is the same as the actual right, for starting corner 1 the relative right is the same as the top of the starting zone, etc...)

        Returns:
        true if the tunnel is situated at the "relative right" of the starting zone. Tested on 11/10/2018 by Eliott Bourachot

      • getMaxTunnelLength

        private static int getMaxTunnelLength()
        Returns:
        the maximum of the tunnel's length in the X and Y direction. Tested on 11/10/2018 by Eliott Bourachot

      • findRings

        private static int[][] findRings(int[][] ringArray,
                                 double[][] route,
                                 SampleProvider colorMean,
                                 float[] colorData)

        Enables the robot to travel around the tree with the given route.

        For each side that the robot travels on, it detects the ring on the top level of the tree, and then on the bottom level of the tree. It fills in the ringArray as it goes.

        Parameters:
        ringArray -
        route -
        colorMean -
        colorData -
        Returns:
        an updated ringArray filled with the lejos.Color of the rings detected.

      • pickUpRings

        private static int pickUpRings(int[][] ringArray,
                               double[][] route,
                               int currentSide)

        Enables to robot to pick up all of the rings according to the given ringArray.

        Picks up the rings in most-expensive to least-expensive order.

        Navigates to the desired ring's side by the most efficient route.

        Picks up the ring by lowering the front arm to a pre-determined angle and lifting the ring of the tree.

        Parameters:
        ringArray -
        route -
        currentSide -
        Returns:
        the side that the robot is on when it has finished picking up the rings

      • unloadRings

        private static void unloadRings()

        Enables the robot to unload the rings from the robot.

        It will only be called when the robot is back in its home area.

        The unloading of the rings will be done using a medium motor.

        The motor will lower the back wall of the basket, then the robot will move back and forth until the rings are unloaded.
